tool_description: The OpenUV Global UV Index Forecast API in JSON format provides Ultraviolet Radiation index data in real time. With the API, developers can build wearable apps, bots, and smart home assistants, based on data provided by The Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI), The National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research (NIWA) of New Zealand, Ozone data from OMI datasets, AURA Satellite, and NASA. It includes JSON responses and API Key.
name: OpenUV - Global Real-Time UV Index Forecast
title: OpenUV - Global Real-Time UV Index Forecast
tool_name: OpenUV - Global Real-Time UV Index Forecast

api_list.name: Real-time UV Index
api_list.description: Get real-time UV Index by location. Optional altitude, ozone level and date and time could be provided.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://aershov-openuv-global-real-time-uv-index-v1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/uv?lat=latitude, from -90.00 to 90.00&lng=longitude, from -180.00 to 180.00"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "aershov-openuv-global-real-time-uv-index-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://aershov-openuv-global-real-time-uv-index-v1.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/uv?lat={lat}&lng={lng}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "aershov-openuv-global-real-time-uv-index-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Hourly UV Index Forecast
api_list.description: Get hourly UV Index Forecast by location and date. Optional altitude, ozone level and date and time could be provided.
